instructions: In Find My iPhone on iCloud.com, tap All Devices, then select the device you want to erase. If you do not see All Devices, it is because you have already selected a device. Tap the name of the current device in the centre of the toolbar to access the Devices list, then select a new device. Tap Erase [ device ]. Do one of the following, depending on what you want to erase: iPhone, iPad, iPod touch or Apple Watch: enter your Apple ID password or your family member s Apple ID password. If you are not using a trusted browser, answer your security questions or enter the verification code that is sent to your other devices. If you are using your own device and want to skip the verification step in the future, tap Trust. If you are using a friend s device, tap Don t Trust. Mac: enter your Apple ID password or your family member s Apple ID password. If you are not using a trusted browser, answer your security questions or enter the verification code that is sent to your other devices. If you are using your own device and want to skip the verification step in the future, tap Trust. If you are using a friend s device, tap Don t Trust. Enter a passcode to lock the Mac (you need to use the passcode to unlock it). For more information about trusted browsers, see the Apple Support article Two-factor authentication for Apple ID . If the device is lost and you are asked to enter a phone number or message, you may want to indicate that the device is lost or how to contact you. The number and message appear on the device s locked screen.

In Find My iPhone on iCloud.com, tap All Devices, then select the device. If you do not see All Devices, it is because you have already selected a device. Tap the name of the current device in the centre of the toolbar to access the Devices list, then select a new device. Tap Stop Erase Request, then enter your Apple ID password.
